course.title: IBM App Connect Enterprise
audience: Individuals preparing for IBM ACE certification
course.prerequisites: Basic knowledge of integration concepts, REST APIs, and familiarity with JSON or XML. Experience with Java or ESQL is beneficial but not required.

modules.title: Introduction to IBM App Connect Enterprise
modules.description: This module introduces IBM App Connect Enterprise, its architecture, and core components for building integration solutions.

sections.title: Overview of IBM ACE
sections.overview: IBM ACE combines IBM Integration Bus with cloud-native capabilities for hybrid integration.
examples: Message Flows: Process data between applications.

sections.title: Integration Architecture
sections.overview: Supports Enterprise Service Bus (ESB) and Agile Integration Architecture (AIA).

sections.title: Key Components
sections.overview: Components include integration nodes, servers, and message flows.

sections.title: Installation and Setup
sections.overview: Steps to install and configure ACE on Windows or Linux.
examples: ACE Toolkit: Install on development machine.

knowledge_check.question: What is IBM App Connect Enterprise primarily used for?
What is a key feature of IBM ACE?
What component manages integration servers in ACE?
What does ESB stand for in IBM ACE?
What is the role of the ACE Toolkit?
options: B: Develop and test message flows

knowledge_check.question: What type of integration does AIA support?
What is a message flow in IBM ACE?
options: B: A sequence of processing steps for data

knowledge_check.question: What platform can IBM ACE be installed on?
What does an integration server execute?
What is a benefit of IBM ACE in hybrid environments?
options: B: Connects cloud and on-premises systems

knowledge_check.question: What is the purpose of an integration node?
What is a characteristic of AIA?
What tool is used to develop ACE message flows?
What does IBM ACE integrate?
options: B: Data and applications across environments

knowledge_check.question: What is a key component of IBM ACE?
What does the ACE installation process configure?
What is a benefit of using IBM ACE?
What is the role of the integration server?
What does IBM ACE support for message processing?
What is a feature of IBM ACE v12?

modules.title: Message Flows and Transformation
modules.description: This module covers creating and managing message flows, including transformation techniques using compute nodes, ESQL, and mapping nodes.

sections.title: Message Flow Basics
sections.overview: Message flows define data processing logic between input and output nodes.
examples: Input Node: Receives REST API requests.

sections.title: Transformation Nodes
sections.overview: Nodes like Compute, Java Compute, and Mapping transform data formats.
examples: Compute Node: Uses ESQL for transformation.
Mapping Node: Converts JSON to XML.

sections.title: Message Formats
sections.overview: Supports JSON, XML, CSV, and fixed-length messages.

sections.title: Subflows and Libraries
sections.overview: Reusable subflows and libraries enhance modularity.

modules.title: Connectors and Protocols
modules.description: This module explores IBM ACE connectors and supported protocols like REST, SOAP, MQ, and file-based communication.

sections.title: REST and SOAP APIs
sections.overview: ACE supports REST and SOAP for web-based integration.

sections.title: MQ Integration
sections.overview: IBM MQ enables queue-based messaging for reliable delivery.
examples: MQ Node: Sends messages to queues.

sections.title: File-Based Integration
sections.overview: File nodes handle CSV, fixed-length, and other file formats.
examples: File Input Node: Reads CSV files.
File Output Node: Writes transformed data.

sections.title: Discovery Connectors
sections.overview: Connectors integrate with SaaS and enterprise applications.
examples: SAP Connector: Connects to ERP systems.

modules.title: Administration and Configuration
modules.description: This module covers administration tasks, including integration node setup, server management, and WebUI configuration.

sections.title: Integration Node Setup
sections.overview: Configure integration nodes for managing servers.
examples: Node Creation: Set up via command line.

sections.title: Integration Server Management
sections.overview: Manage standalone and node-managed servers.
examples: Node-Managed Server: Controlled by integration node.

sections.title: WebUI Configuration
sections.overview: WebUI enables server management and monitoring.
examples: REST Admin Port: Configures WebUI access.

sections.title: Vault and Credentials
sections.overview: Vault secures credentials for database and server access.

modules.title: Monitoring and Debugging
modules.description: This module covers tools and techniques for monitoring, debugging, and logging in IBM ACE, including record and replay features.

sections.title: Business Transaction Monitoring
sections.overview: Monitors transaction performance and issues.

sections.title: Record and Replay
sections.overview: Captures and replays messages for debugging.

sections.title: Logging and Tracing
sections.overview: Logs and traces provide debugging insights.
examples: User Trace: Logs message flow execution.

sections.title: Troubleshooting Tools
sections.overview: Tools like WebUI and command-line interfaces aid debugging.

modules.title: Advanced Features and Exam Prep
modules.description: This module covers advanced IBM ACE features like group nodes, policies, and exam preparation strategies for certifications.

sections.title: Group and Aggregate Nodes
sections.overview: Group, Collector, and Aggregate nodes handle complex data processing.
examples: Collector Node: Collects messages for processing.

sections.title: Policy Projects
sections.overview: Policies define reusable configurations for services.

sections.title: User-Defined Extensions
sections.overview: Custom nodes extend ACE functionality.

sections.title: Exam Preparation
sections.overview: Practice exams and hands-on labs prepare for certification.
examples: Lab: Builds message flow for testing.

hands_on_labs: Create a message flow to transform JSON to XML using a Mapping Node.
Configure an integration node and server using command-line tools.
Set up a REST API integration with a Salesforce Connector.
Implement a record and replay feature to debug a message flow.
Develop a custom node to process a proprietary message format.
resources: IBM App Connect Enterprise V12 Documentation.
IBM ACE Toolkit and sample message flows.
IBM Certified Solution Developer - App Connect Enterprise V11 Study Guide.
Online practice exams and tutorials from IBM Skills Network.
additional_notes.environment: Access to IBM ACE Toolkit, IBM MQ, and a virtual lab environment for integration testing.
